delete.summary: Deletes a device by its token, stops sending PUSH-notifications to it.

parameters.name: push
parameters.description: PUSH Notification subscription

put.summary: Register device to receive PUSH notifications

parameters.name: push
parameters.description: PUSH Notification subscription

post.summary:
// Authorization Request. Part of OAuth flow
rpc Auth(AuthRequest) returns (AuthResponse);

get.summary: Search retrieves a paginated list of contacts based on filters and search queries.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve (starts from 1).

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of items per page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria (e.g., "name" or "-created_at").

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: List of specific fields to include in the response. If empty, all fields are returned.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Full-text search query (matches against name or username).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter by channel types (e.g., ["telegram", "viber"]).

parameters.name: subjects
parameters.description: Filter by internal system subjects/user IDs.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Represents a request to send a message with document.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Represents a request to send an message with image.

post.summary:
SendText delivers a plain text message.
We use the shared Request/Response types directly to avoid duplication.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Represents a request to send a text message.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
List of fields that should be returned in the response.
If empty, a default set of fields is returned.
Used for response optimization.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Filter by specific thread IDs.

parameters.name: kinds
parameters.description:
Filter threads by their kinds.
UNKNOWN (0) is not allowed.

 - UNKNOWN: Unknown or unspecified thread type.
Must not be used in valid requests.
 - DIRECT: One-to-one private thread between two users.
 - GROUP: Group thread with multiple members.
 - CHANNEL: Channel-style thread (broadcast or topic based communication).

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Full-text search query.
Typically applied to subject.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description:
Maximum number of threads to return per page.
Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 100.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sorting field.
Optional "+" or "-" prefix indicates ascending or descending order.
Example: "-created_at", "subject"

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (1-based).

get.summary:
Searches messages within a specific thread.
Supports cursor-based pagination and field selection.

parameters.name: thread_ids
parameters.description: Filter by thread IDs.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
List of message fields to be returned.
Used to reduce payload size.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Filter by specific message IDs.

parameters.name: sender_ids
parameters.description: Filter messages by sender user IDs.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Filter messages by message types.

parameters.name: cursor.created_at
parameters.description: Message creation timestamp (Unix time, microseconds).

parameters.name: cursor.id
parameters.description: Unique message identifier.

parameters.name: cursor.direction
parameters.description:
Pagination direction.
true - backward (older messages).
false - forward (newer messages).

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return.

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server
implementations and no plans to implement one.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

google.protobuf.NullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

token_type.description: REQUIRED. The type of the token issued. Value is case insensitive.

access_token.description: REQUIRED. The access token issued by the authorization server.

refresh_token.description:
OPTIONAL. The refresh token, which can be used to obtain
new access tokens using the same authorization grant.

expires_in.description: RECOMMENDED. The lifetime in seconds of the access token.

scope.description:
OPTIONAL, if identical to the scope requested by the client;
otherwise, REQUIRED. The scope of the access token.

state.description:
REQUIRED if the "state" parameter was present in the client
authorization request. The exact value received from the client.

iss.description:
REQUIRED. Issuer Identifier for the Issuer of the response.
The iss value is a case sensitive URL using the https scheme that contains scheme, host,
and optionally, port number and path components and no query or fragment components.

sub.description:
REQUIRED. Subject Identifier.
A locally unique and never reassigned identifier within the Issuer for the End-User,
which is intended to be consumed by the Client, e.g., 24400320 or AItOawmwtWwcT0k51BayewNvutrJUqsvl6qs7A4.
It MUST NOT exceed 255 ASCII characters in length.
The sub value is a case sensitive string.

name.description:
REQUIRED. End-User's full name in displayable form including all name parts,
possibly including titles and suffixes, ordered according to the End-User's locale and preferences.

middle_name.description:
Middle name(s) of the End-User.
Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple middle names;
all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.
Also note that in some cultures, middle names are not used.

birthdate.description:
OPTIONAL. End-User's birthday, represented as an ISO 8601:2004 [ISO8601‑2004] YYYY-MM-DD format.
The year MAY be 0000, indicating that it is omitted.
To represent only the year, YYYY format is allowed.

zoneinfo.description:
OPTIONAL. String from zoneinfo [zoneinfo] time zone database representing the End-User's time zone.
For example, Europe/Kyiv or America/Los_Angeles.

profile.description:
OPTIONAL. URL of the End-User's profile page.
The contents of this Web page SHOULD be about the End-User.
NOTE: Issuer SP (IdP) related URL.

picture.description:
OPTIONAL. URL of the End-User's profile picture.
This URL MUST refer to an image file
(for example, a PNG, JPEG, or GIF image file),
rather than to a Web page containing an image.

gender.description:
OPTIONAL. End-User's gender.
Values defined by this specification are `female` and `male`.
Other values MAY be used when neither of the defined values are applicable.

locale.description:
End-User's locale, represented as a BCP47 [RFC5646] language tag.
This is typically an ISO 639-1 Alpha-2 [ISO639‑1] language code in lowercase
and an ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 [ISO3166‑1] country code in uppercase,
separated by a dash. For example, `en-US` or `uk-UA`.

email.description:
End-User's preferred e-mail address.
Its value MUST conform to the RFC 5322 [RFC5322] addr-spec syntax.
The RP MUST NOT rely upon this value being unique, as discussed in Section 5.7.

email_verified.description: True if the End-User's e-mail address has been verified; otherwise false.

phone_number.description:
End-User's preferred telephone number.
E.164 is RECOMMENDED as the format of this Claim, for example, +1 (425) 555-1212 or +56 (2) 687 2400.
If the phone number contains an extension, it is RECOMMENDED that
the extension be represented using the RFC 3966 [RFC3966] extension syntax, for example, +1 (604) 555-1234;ext=5678.

phone_number_verified.description: True if the End-User's phone number has been verified; otherwise false.

created_at.description:
Time the End-User's information was last updated.
Its value is a JSON number representing the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z as measured in UTC until the date/time.

token.title: OPTIONAL. Grant of an [access_token] for this session Authorization

current.title: Whether this is the current session

app_id.description: Identifier of the specific integration app or bot.

metadata.description: Additional dynamic attributes provided by the messenger.

created_at.description: Record creation timestamp (Unix Epoch in milliseconds).

updated_at.description: Last record update timestamp (Unix Epoch in milliseconds).

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.Contact.description: Contact represents an external messaging identity.

size.description: Number of items returned in this batch.

next.description: Indicates if there are more pages available.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.ContactList.description: SearchList represents a paginated collection of Contact entities.

after.description: Cursor pointing to the next page of results.

before.description: Cursor pointing to the previous page of results.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.Cursors.description:
Cursors contains for navigating
forward and backward through message history.

message_id.description: Identifier of the message this document belongs to.

url.description: Public signed URL for downloading the document.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.Document.description:
Document represents a file attachment
associated with a message.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.DocumentInput.description:
Represents `Document` message with necessary fields
to process it into frequently used `document`
entity in messaging systems.

subject.description: Client-readable participant subject or display name.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.ExternalPartic.description:
ExternalParticipant represents aggregated participant information
present in the thread history response.

thread_id.description: Identifier of the thread the message belongs to.

metadata.description:
Arbitrary message metadata.
Can contain structured data depending on message type.

updated_at.description: Message last update timestamp (Unix time, milliseconds).

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.HistoryMessage.description:
HistoryMessage represents a single message
in thread history.

direction.description:
Pagination direction.
true - backward (older messages).
false - forward (newer messages).

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.HistoryMessage.description:
HistoryMessageCursor represents a cursor used for
cursor based pagination of message history.

iss.description:
REQUIRED. Issuer Identifier for the Issuer of the response.
The iss value is a case sensitive URL using the https scheme that contains scheme, host,
and optionally, port number and path components and no query or fragment components.

sub.description:
REQUIRED. Subject Identifier.
A locally unique and never reassigned identifier within the Issuer for the End-User,
which is intended to be consumed by the Client, e.g., 24400320 or AItOawmwtWwcT0k51BayewNvutrJUqsvl6qs7A4.
It MUST NOT exceed 255 ASCII characters in length.
The sub value is a case sensitive string.

name.description:
REQUIRED. End-User's full name in displayable form including all name parts,
possibly including titles and suffixes, ordered according to the End-User's locale and preferences.

middle_name.description:
Middle name(s) of the End-User.
Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple middle names;
all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.
Also note that in some cultures, middle names are not used.

birthdate.description:
OPTIONAL. End-User's birthday, represented as an ISO 8601:2004 [ISO8601‑2004] YYYY-MM-DD format.
The year MAY be 0000, indicating that it is omitted.
To represent only the year, YYYY format is allowed.

zoneinfo.description:
OPTIONAL. String from zoneinfo [zoneinfo] time zone database representing the End-User's time zone.
For example, Europe/Kyiv or America/Los_Angeles.

profile.description:
OPTIONAL. URL of the End-User's profile page.
The contents of this Web page SHOULD be about the End-User.
NOTE: Issuer SP (IdP) related URL.

picture.description:
OPTIONAL. URL of the End-User's profile picture.
This URL MUST refer to an image file
(for example, a PNG, JPEG, or GIF image file),
rather than to a Web page containing an image.

gender.description:
OPTIONAL. End-User's gender.
Values defined by this specification are `female` and `male`.
Other values MAY be used when neither of the defined values are applicable.

locale.description:
End-User's locale, represented as a BCP47 [RFC5646] language tag.
This is typically an ISO 639-1 Alpha-2 [ISO639‑1] language code in lowercase
and an ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 [ISO3166‑1] country code in uppercase,
separated by a dash. For example, `en-US` or `uk-UA`.

email.description:
End-User's preferred e-mail address.
Its value MUST conform to the RFC 5322 [RFC5322] addr-spec syntax.
The RP MUST NOT rely upon this value being unique, as discussed in Section 5.7.

email_verified.description: True if the End-User's e-mail address has been verified; otherwise false.

phone_number.description:
End-User's preferred telephone number.
E.164 is RECOMMENDED as the format of this Claim, for example, +1 (425) 555-1212 or +56 (2) 687 2400.
If the phone number contains an extension, it is RECOMMENDED that
the extension be represented using the RFC 3966 [RFC3966] extension syntax, for example, +1 (604) 555-1234;ext=5678.

phone_number_verified.description: True if the End-User's phone number has been verified; otherwise false.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.Identity.title:
Identity (IdToken) of the Contact at the Issuer.
https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#Claims

message_id.description: Identifier of the message this message belongs to.

url.description: Public signed URL for accessing the image.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.Image.description:
Image represents an image attachment
associated with a message.

subject.description: Client-readable sender subject or display name.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.MessagePartici.description:
MessageParticipant represents aggregated participant information
present in the message history response.

web.title:
For 10 web push, the token must be a JSON-encoded object with the following keys:
endpoint: Absolute URL exposed by the push service where the application server can send push messages
keys: P-256 elliptic curve Diffie-Hellman parameters in the following object
p256dh: Base64url-encoded P-256 elliptic curve Diffie-Hellman public key
auth: Base64url-encoded authentication secret

secret.title: For FCM and APNS VoIP, optional encryption key used to encrypt push notifications

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.Peer.description:
Represents a peer in the messaging system.
It can be a user, chat, or channel.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.RegisterDevice.title: No Reply ; Error status if failed

messages.description: List of messages matching the search criteria.

next_cursor.description: Cursor pointing to the next page of messages.

next.description: Indicates whether more messages are available.

from.description:
List of unique message senders present
in the current response page.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SearchMessageH.description:
SearchMessageHistoryResponse contains
message history search results and pagination metadata.

threads.description: List of threads matching the search criteria.

next.description: Indicates whether there is a next page available.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SearchThreadRe.description:
SearchThreadResponse contains the list of threads
and pagination metadata.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SendDocumentRe.description: Represents a request to send a message with document.
Represents a response to send message with document.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SendImageReque.description: Represents a request to send an message with image.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SendImageRespo.description: Represents a response to send message with image.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SendTextReques.description: Represents a request to send a text message.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SendTextRespon.description: Represents a response to send a text message.

owner.description: Aggregated user information of the thread owner.

admins.description: List of users aggregated information with admin privileges.

member_ids.description: List of member users aggregated information.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.Thread.description: Thread represents a thread (aka chat or conversation) entity.

title.description:
Custom title for the direct thread.
Usually represents the display name of the conversation.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.ThreadDirectSe.description:
ThreadDirectSettings defines settings
specific to direct (one-to-one) threads.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.ThreadKind.description:
ThreadKind defines the type of a thread.
It determines the business rules and available features for the thread.

 - UNKNOWN: Unknown or unspecified thread type.
Must not be used in valid requests.
 - DIRECT: One-to-one private thread between two users.
 - GROUP: Group thread with multiple members.
 - CHANNEL: Channel-style thread (broadcast or topic based communication).

direct_settings.description:
Direct thread specific settings.
Present only for DIRECT threads.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.ThreadMember.description:
ThreadMember represents a thread participant
with optional type-specific settings.

state.title:
RECOMMENDED. An opaque value used by the client to maintain
state between the request and callback.  The authorization
server includes this value when redirecting the user-agent back
to the client.  The parameter SHOULD be used for preventing
cross-site request forgery

scope.title:
OPTIONAL. The scope of the access request
Posible values are:
* chat ; [I]nstant [M]essaging service
* call ; [V]oice[o]ver[IP] SIP service

client_id.description:
The client identifier issued to the client during the registration process.
REQUIRED, if the client is not authenticating with the authorization server.
May be transmitted in header: [X-Webitel-Client].

client_secret.description:
REQUIRED. The client secret. The client MAY omit the
parameter if the client secret is an empty string.

Including the client credentials in the request-body using the two
parameters is NOT RECOMMENDED and SHOULD be limited to clients unable
to directly utilize the HTTP Basic authentication scheme (or other
password-based HTTP authentication schemes). The parameters can only
be transmitted in the request-body and MUST NOT be included in the
request URI.

Keep it a secret.

code.description:
Authorization code grant.
REQUIRED. When grant_type is set to "authorization_code".

refresh_token.description:
Refresh token string to obtain NEW access token.
REQUIRED. When grant_type is set to "refresh_token".

identity.description:
Identity of the end-User account association.
REQUIRED. When grant_type is set to "identity".

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.UnregisterDevi.title: No Reply ; Error status if failed

endpoint.title: endpoint: Absolute URL exposed by the push service where the application server can send push messages

p256dh.title: p256dh: Base64url-encoded P-256 elliptic curve Diffie-Hellman public key

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.WebPushSubscri.title:
keys: P-256 elliptic curve Diffie-Hellman parameters in the following object
p256dh: Base64url-encoded P-256 elliptic curve Diffie-Hellman public key
auth: Base64url-encoded authentication secret
